location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Draft of a letter from Captain David Wilson, Resident at Bushire, to Assoo, Agent at Bahrain

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has two different foliation sequences. The first is part of an original foliation sequence which was applied to the whole volume. It is written in ink and appears at the top right (recto) or top left (verso) corner of the folio. The second foliation number is a small pencil number enclosed in a circle which also appears in the top right corner (recto) only, this is the foliation number that has been used in referencing this item.Condition: The item has suffered from slight insect damage, but this does not affect the reading of the text.

mods.abstract: This letter refers to an act of piracy and lack of adequate information on the matter from the agent, the matter of the wearing of a flag, and an 'outrage' committed on the boat of Ahmed bin Aawajah. It also includes a list of questions that Wilson requires answers to regarding an act of piracy on the boat of Abdoolah bin Moashary Nachoda Hashel, and also regarding the boat of Ahmed bin Aawajah Nachoda Moobarack.
